fields.Title: BOARDWALK / FELD MURAL
fields.Description:
1. Observe the mural.
2. Shivers White Check to see stairs, which then allows you to use the ladder to get to the roof.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Some sort of industrial ruin? I do..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Some sort of industrial ruin? I don't recognize the name of the company. R&D used to mean Research and Development... It looks long-abandoned."

fields.Title: Shivers: "Even though you're *sure* you succe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Even though you're *sure* you succeeded, all is quiet. There is no cold hand brushing against your forehead, no rustle in the reeds -- the wind has died down. The ruin in front of you is silent as a tomb.

fields.Title: You: "Say: "I think she's down *there*. B..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Say: "I think she's down *there*. Below this building."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay..." The lieutenant looks down..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay..." The lieutenant looks down the coast, toward the shacks. "When you're ready, officer."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Let's see, let's see... Just flicki..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Let's see, let's see... Just flicking through the index of your knowledge...

fields.Title: You: "Does that mean she's *here*?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Does that mean she's *here*?

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "You see a once-bright mural towerin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You see a once-bright mural towering above you. The signage has peeled off over the years, but you can still make out: 'FELD ELECTRICAL R&D'.

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "You try to peer in but there are no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You try to peer in but there are no windows on this side. Only the disinterested whistle of the wind.

fields.Title: You: "She could be *anywhere*, how do I f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She could be *anywhere*, how do I find her?

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "The once-bright mural towers above..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The once-bright mural towers above you, saying "FELD ELECTRICAL R&D."
fields.Alternate1: The once-bright mural towers above you, saying "FELD ELECTRICAL R&D: Tomorrow is just a whisper away."

fields.Title: Shivers: "For what? A song carried on the bre..."
fields.Dialogue Text: For what? A song carried on the breeze? Or children laughing, far away? You walk and walk these city streets and deserted coast, and all it ever tells you -- is cold.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course. Black magic. The most p..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course. Black magic. The most potent type of magic. If we're that desperate -- may I suggest getting shovels and digging?" A quiver of a smile.

fields.Title: Shivers: "For what? God? God is very, very si..."
fields.Dialogue Text: For what? God? God is very, very silent. Too silent. Even the wind seems tired...
fields.Alternate1: Be honest. You're praying. It's that bad.

fields.Title: You: "Yes, Comrade Zephyr. I shall find t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, Comrade Zephyr. I shall find them. Girl Child Revolution and Girl Child Communism!

fields.Title: You: "Cool. No rush."
fields.Dialogue Text: Cool. No rush.

fields.Title: You: "But?"
fields.Dialogue Text: But?

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Ask the wind or 'Aska i Vinden' is..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ask the wind or 'Aska i Vinden' is the name of a Vaasan lullaby," he remarks. "Maybe that helps?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He stops to consider your words. "*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He stops to consider your words. "*Ask the wind* sounds like an expression. For when you have no idea. We should continue our search. Perhaps even get a little desperate..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right," he shrugs. "How do we get..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Right," he shrugs. "How do we get in there? The doors were on the collapsed side of this building... they're gone, basically."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good, good, yes. Cold spells..." H..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good, good, yes. Cold spells..." He seems incredulous. "So basically your *hangover* is telling you she's down there?"

fields.Title: You: "Why do I feel like I know this plac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why do I feel like I know this place?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "We have, uh... Radio brands, radio..."
fields.Dialogue Text: We have, uh... Radio brands, radio crimes, radio comedies, radio dramas, radio physics, radio psychics, radio scandals, radio shows, and way more in-between, but, uh....

fields.Title: You: ""Is this all I am? A fount of usele..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Is this all I am? A fount of useless radio trivia?"

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Land's End? You took in the sights..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Land's End? You took in the sights there with Lilienne. Ruby wasn't up the disused radio tower, among the reeds, or beneath the boardwalk.

fields.Title: You: ""The wind didn't tell me to wait.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The wind didn't tell me to wait."

fields.Title: You: ""Who said that?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who said that?"

fields.Title: You: ""I am performing *black magic*.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I am performing *black magic*."

fields.Title: Logic: "Great idea!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Great idea!

fields.Title: You: "What is happening..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What is happening...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Doesn't look like it to me." He pa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Doesn't look like it to me." He pauses to study you for a moment. "Probably not, anyway."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Still nothing. Your head is full of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Still nothing. Your head is full of obscure facts, none of which are helpful here. Move on before you make another scene.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Nothing that would be useful here...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Nothing that would be useful here. Sorry.

fields.Title: Shivers: "Suddenly there's a sigh, carried on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Suddenly there's a sigh, carried on the molecules around you, moving, flowing from high pressure to low pressure. Like that of a woman emptying her lungs. She wraps the collapsing stone box in front of you in her breath, flowing through it...

fields.Title: You: ""The twins did hear the radio from..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The twins did hear the radio from here, so *something* is happening..."
"Looks like tomorrow never came." The lieutenant raises the collar of his bomber jacket.
fields.Alternate1: "Looks like tomorrow never came." The lieutenant raises the collar of his jacket.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you shiver,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks at you shiver, worried suddenly. "We should go. It gets cold if you stand in one place too long."

fields.Title: Shivers: "In through the collapsed roof, flow..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In through the collapsed roof, flowing down a concrete staircase -- to the basement, sweeping away footprints in the dust on the stairs. And then the beach below the boardwalk, its winding tunnels... a whisper away.

fields.Title: Shivers: "A breeze, like a quiet sigh, moves..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A breeze, like a quiet sigh, moves over you. The cool air breaks across your body. It brings the salt of the sea into your lungs.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer?" The lieutenant watches y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Officer?" The lieutenant watches you attentively. "Are you okay? It looked like we lost you for a second."

fields.Title: You: "Pull on your knowledge to understan..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Pull on your knowledge to understand what caused the twins to hear radio in their heads.
fields.tooltip3: Heard stories from Idiot Doom Spiral.

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["TASK.return_to_mural_for_new_check"] == true  and  Variable["boardwalk.mural_encycloedia_pass_check"] == false  and  IsKimHere()  and  Variable["TASK.ask_the_wind_done"] == false

fields.Title: You: ""Can we look into that later?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Can we look into that later?"

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Or spiritual? She could be looking..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Or spiritual? She could be looking for refuge...

fields.Title: Shivers: "How hard can it be? You were told s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How hard can it be? You were told she's north of the village and this place is a peninsula. Look around. West of here there are people, talking. Who could it be, you cup your ear and think?
fields.Alternate1: How hard can it be? You were told she's north of the village and this place is a peninsula. West of here there are the cryptozoologists -- helping them might give you a reason to map out the place.
fields.Alternate2: How hard can it be? You were told she's north of the village and this place is a peninsula. You've already mapped it out while checking the traps. So you *know* the place.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He stops to consider your words. "*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He stops to consider your words. "*Ask Revachol* sounds like an expression. For when you have no idea. We should continue our search. Perhaps even get a little desperate..."

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Blood spatter reading, rooster sac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Blood spatter reading, rooster sacrifice -- still quite common in Revachol," he remarks. "Hope it helps."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Anyway -- we do it the old fashion..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Anyway -- we do it the old fashioned way: sector by sector. Go over the whole peninsula, ask the locals, enter the places where we *can* enter first. Like we did in the village."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How *do* we? I was really hoping s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "How *do* we? I was really hoping she'd be in the village..." The lieutenant sighs, then gets a hold of himself: "Okay."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Or spiritual? She could be looking..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Or spiritual? She could be looking for refuge...

fields.Title: Shivers: "Walk the coast, the old boardwalk,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Walk the coast, the old boardwalk, the reeds... You can always come back here and talk to the wind again. Look where it already got you.

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind rushes away, leaving you w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind rushes away, leaving you where you were -- on the rotting boards of the Feld Building.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant clears his throat. "..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant clears his throat. "Let's move on. I don't think we need to stand around anymore."

fields.Title: Savoir Faire: "An adventure awaits! An adventure o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: An adventure awaits! An adventure on the windswept urban coast.

fields.Title: Endurance: "Buckle up and raise your collar --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Buckle up and raise your collar -- this search is going to be wet and cold.

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "It doesn't."
fields.Dialogue Text: It doesn't.

fields.Title: You: ""Tomorrow is just a whisper away...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Tomorrow is just a whisper away..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""She's *probably* north of the vill..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "She's *probably* north of the village and this place is a peninsula. I think there's people west of here, we could ask them..." He looks to his right and cups his ear.
fields.Alternate1: "She's *probably* north of the village and this place is a peninsula. We've already talked to the cryptozoologists..." He looks to his right. "Working with them might give us a good excuse to run around -- give us some *structure*..."
fields.Alternate2: "She's *probably* north of the village and this place is a peninsula." He looks North. "We already scanned most of the outdoor areas on our wild *cryptid hunt*, so we have an understanding of the geography, at least."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He shrugs. "So how do we get in the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He shrugs. "So how do we get in there? The doors were on the collapsed side of this building... they're gone, basically."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm just thinking. This is me thin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm just thinking. This is me thinking. Nothing strange here."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He looks around. "Like -- maybe we..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He looks around. "Like -- maybe we can get shovels and dig?" A quiver of a smile. "Don't mind that -- a bad attempt at humour."

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Lieutenant Kitsuragi stands in fron..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Lieutenant Kitsuragi stands in front of a mirror, fixing his orange bomber jacket. You should be asking him that question.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "You know little about ULAN frequenc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You know little about ULAN frequencies other than that they exist. Maybe? It's impossible to say.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "You know where Ruby *isn't.*"
fields.Dialogue Text: You know where Ruby *isn't.*

fields.Title: You: ""I'm just thinking. This is me thin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm just thinking. This is me thinking. Nothing strange here."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because I *hope* you didn't mean t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Because I *hope* you didn't mean to climb that ladder..." He points to the ladder next to the sign and says: "It's *not* safe."

fields.Title: You: "[Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: "Just blow on your hands for warmth."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just blow on your hands for warmth.

fields.Title: You: ""Call it a gut feeling.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Call it a gut feeling."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "There's something in the wind. Some..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's something in the wind. Sometimes the only way to go forward is to fail first.

fields.Title: You: "What's that?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What's that?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "If she's here on the coast, she'll..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If she's here on the coast, she'll be *here.* And besides, something weird happened to the twins around here. It'd be nice to know what caused that. Another fact for your collection!

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "The writing rises in front of you,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The writing rises in front of you, its ancient carton wet from the coastal air.

fields.Title: You: "(Turn to the lieutenant.) "She coul..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Turn to the lieutenant.) "She could be *anywhere*, how do we find her?"

fields.Title: You: ""There's a ladder next to the sign...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "There's a ladder next to the sign." (Point to it.) "Perhaps we can climb it? Enter through the roof?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe we could, you know..." He po..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Maybe we could, you know..." He points to the man who points at the building, telling his son something. "Ask the man who's pointing at the building?"

fields.Title: You: ""I think I need to talk to some kid..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I think I need to talk to some kids in the village."

fields.Title: You: ""This is part of the investigation..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This is part of the investigation now."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "You know a lot about radio. Enough..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You know a lot about radio. Enough to know: You have no idea how or why those boys heard Speedfreaks FM in their heads.

fields.Title: You: "So I was right! ULAN -- she *is* he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: So I was right! ULAN -- she *is* here!

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Lieutenant Kitsuragi stands in fron..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Lieutenant Kitsuragi stands in front of a mirror, fixing his black bomber jacket. You should be asking him that question.

fields.Title: Logic: "Why single out this one building?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Why single out this one building?

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "A slogan used to intertwine with th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A slogan used to intertwine with the loops a long time ago. Now only a shadow of peeled letters remains. It says: 'Tomorrow is just a whisper away'.

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "Indeed. You hear what sounds like t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Indeed. You hear what sounds like two men arguing where the lieutenant is pointing.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What? I didn't say anything." He l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What? I didn't say anything." He looks at you. "What are we doing here? We keep returning and you act strange."

fields.Title: You: ""Yes. I can literally *talk* to my..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes. I can literally *talk* to my hangover. That's how bad it has gotten."

fields.Title: You: ""Then I've got nothing. I'm a shit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then I've got nothing. I'm a shit detective. I should be in the sewer."

fields.Title: Mikael Heidelstam: ""What is he talking about?" The you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What is he talking about?" The young boy looks to his father, frowning.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Knowledge like that isn't just obsc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Knowledge like that isn't just obscure; it's unknowable. Dangerous theoretical facts like that are probably protected under the Coalition Government's Articles of Dominion, Title XIV, Article 7c. While an expert might be able to suss it out on their own, a layman like you has no hope.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A shuffle of nylon as the lieutenan..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A shuffle of nylon as the lieutenant shrugs. "I don't know... It's your call, detective. If you drop the radio lead now, just be prepared to live without having done it."

fields.Title: Shivers: "And then there's the church. You lo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And then there's the church. You look at the bell tower rising into the clouds -- a prominent place to hide, but maybe she's reckless?
fields.Alternate1: And then there's the church. You look at the bell tower, rising into the sky -- you look East and remember you already searched it. And found no trace of Ruby.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course. We should continue our..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course. We should continue our search."

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "The ruin in front of you is silent..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The ruin in front of you is silent as a tomb.

fields.Title: You: "Shake off the feeling."
fields.Dialogue Text: Shake off the feeling.

fields.Title: You: "Where does it go?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Where does it go?

fields.Title: You: ""The wind told me.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The wind told me."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And then there's the church." He l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And then there's the church." He looks at the bell tower. "If I were a murder suspect I would not hide in the most prominent building here, but who knows? Maybe she's reckless..."
fields.Alternate1: "And then there's the church." He looks at the bell tower. "We've already searched that and can rule it out. I know it doesn't feel like progress, but exclusion is a step too."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "As if said by someone else. Someone..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As if said by someone else. Someone outside you. Around you. Not you.

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "The long abandoned industrial build..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The long abandoned industrial building towers above you in silence.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right. Well, I'm sure that after....."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Right. Well, I'm sure that after..." The lieutenant's words come to a slow halt. He pinches the bridge of his nose.

fields.Title: You: ""You just want to dial your favouri..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You just want to dial your favourite radio station, don't you?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In case she's underground? Don't m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "In case she's underground? Don't mind that -- a bad attempt at humour."

fields.Title: You: ""I am trying to ask Revachol.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I am trying to ask Revachol."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Shivers: "Suddenly there's a sigh, carried on..."]
Feld Mural: "The wind whispers and whispers."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind whispers and whispers.

fields.Title: Shivers: "Listen to the wind -- but for *what..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Listen to the wind -- but for *what*? Ruby whistling? The crackle of her bonfire? Some errant whisper, or a dog barking...

fields.Title: You: ""Could she be in there?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Could she be in there?"

fields.Title: Shivers: "BOY CHILD FREEDOM. BOY CHILD JUSTIC..."
fields.Dialogue Text: BOY CHILD FREEDOM. BOY CHILD JUSTICE.

fields.Title: You: ""The wind told me to talk to childr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The wind told me to talk to children. Let's roll."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""True...  But how do we even get in..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "True...  But how do we even get in there? The doors were on the collapsed side of this building... they're gone, basically."
fields.Alternate1: "True. And Ruby does have radio experience, as evidenced by her lorry... But how do we even get in there? The doors were on the collapsed side of this building... they're gone, basically."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "That isn't a fact *yet*. But it's a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That isn't a fact *yet*. But it's a compelling suspicion.

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""She?" The man hears you. "I don't..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "She?" The man hears you. "I don't know who you mean, but... the building seems long-abandoned to me."

fields.Title: Shivers: "First you need to tune in to the co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: First you need to tune in to the coast, get to know its residents. Then you can search where you can't enter: bunkers, storm drainage, this building here. You can always come back and talk to the wind again -- look where it already got you.

fields.Title: Shivers: "You felt it, before, when it rained..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You felt it, before, when it rained in Martinaise and you *felt* the cold of the rain. The feeling persists. It has been in you ever since.

fields.Title: You: "[Turn away.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Turn away.]

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Perhaps *you* can climb them. *We'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Perhaps *you* can climb them. *We're* not climbing anything. I'm 43 years old -- and I plan to live to see 70."

fields.Title: You: "What the hell was that?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What the hell was that?

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "The big sea... The Big C? That can..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The big sea... The Big C? That can only mean one thing: Communism.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Searching with all possible speed!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Searching with all possible speed!

fields.Title: You: "I know about ULAN frequencies. Does..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I know about ULAN frequencies. Does that help?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "And, while you might not have seen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And, while you might not have seen much of the coast, you were probably right: The ULAN frequency is likely connected to all this. Ruby dabbles in advanced radio theories. The Speedfreaks FM case is a radio mystery. That may not be coincidence.
fields.Alternate1: And you were probably right: The ULAN frequency is likely connected to all this. Ruby dabbles in advanced radio theories. The Speedfreaks FM case is a radio mystery. That may not be coincidence.

fields.Title: You: "And if that fails? If I don't find..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And if that fails? If I don't find her? (Conclude.)

fields.Title: You: ""I am trying to ask the wind.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I am trying to ask the wind."

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Ah, yes, their famous motto!" You..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ah, yes, their famous motto!" You hear the man exclaim behind you. "A fine example of technological optimism, from..." He says something, but the wind blows and you can't hear him.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then -- if we're desperate -- we c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then -- if we're desperate -- we can look where we *can't* enter. Bunkers, storm drainage, this place. I'm sure it won't come to that." He looks behind him, at the dark red box crumbling across the chasm.

fields.Title: Shivers: "Suddenly, all is quiet. There is no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Suddenly, all is quiet. There is no cold hand brushing against your forehead, no rustle in the reeds. The wind has died down, or gone behind a corner? You only hear distant waves washing the coast.

fields.Title: You: ""I am trying to ask Revachol.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I am trying to ask Revachol."

fields.Title: You: ""Did I have a seizure, Kim?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Did I have a seizure, Kim?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""When you're ready." The lieutenant..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "When you're ready." The lieutenant nods.

fields.Title: Half Light: "Judging eyes, like he's a fucking b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Judging eyes, like he's a fucking brain doctor. What the hell does he know?

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "Above the mural -- a collapsed roof..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Above the mural -- a collapsed roof, broken windows set in walls that are cracking and will soon also fall, and the coastal breeze rustling and sighing in the remains of the edifice.

fields.Title: You: ""I am performing *black magic*.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I am performing *black magic*."

fields.Title: You: ""I am trying to ask the wind.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I am trying to ask the wind."

fields.Title: You: "What am I *doing* here?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What am I *doing* here?

fields.Title: Shivers: "*THERE IS NOTHING ELSE.* The though..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *THERE IS NOTHING ELSE.* The thought makes your bones rattle, like the skeleton of some deserted building ready to collapse.

fields.Title: Shivers: "Trying to talk to the wind, or the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Trying to talk to the wind, or the city? Whatever you thought would happen did not, and now you're just standing there with your hands fallen to your side.
fields.Alternate1: Trying to talk to the wind, the city? Whatever you thought would happen did not, and now you're just standing there, in the dark. With your hands fallen to your side.
fields.Alternate2: Trying to talk to the wind? The city? Whatever you thought would happen did not, and now you're just standing there, in the pale of the morning. With your hands fallen to your side.
fields.Alternate3: Trying to talk to the wind? The city? Whatever you thought would happen did not, and now you're just standing there with your hands fallen to your side.
fields.Alternate4: Trying to talk to the wind? The city? Whatever you thought would happen did not, and now you're just standing there, in the dusk hour. With your hands fallen to your side.

fields.Title: Savoir Faire: "Finally, my time to shine!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Finally, my time to shine!

fields.Title: Shivers: "GO TO THE CHILDREN OF THE BIG SEA."
fields.Dialogue Text: GO TO THE CHILDREN OF THE BIG SEA.

fields.Title: You: ""Radio is killing the fucking cop s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Radio is killing the fucking cop star. Come on!"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A shuffle of nylon as the lieutenan..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A shuffle of nylon as the lieutenant shrugs. "I'm only observing that there's another lead you wanted to follow. And that if you drop the radio lead now, just be prepared to live without having done it."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Feld *Electrical*. How ironic -- al..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Feld *Electrical*. How ironic -- all these dark rooms...

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "Indeed. About 70 metres west from h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Indeed. About 70 metres west from here.

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Well..." The man behind you hesita..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well..." The man behind you hesitates for a moment. "I was *trying* to explain to Mikael what it is the officer keeps returning here for -- then I realized I don't know."

fields.Title: You: "What was I even attempting to do he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What was I even attempting to do here?

fields.Title: You: ""We've looked everywhere else.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "We've looked everywhere else."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In there? She could. Or..." The li..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "In there? She could. Or..." The lieutenant points behind you. "She could be in the *identical* ruin over there, or in that boat shack. In that church tower, maybe..."

fields.Title: You: ""I need to go to the children, Kim...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I need to go to the children, Kim. Girl Child Communism. Boy Child Freedom."

fields.Title: Logic: "Is *trying to talk to the city* som..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Is *trying to talk to the city* something you've done before? Is it in your secret repertoire -- a trick for when you're out of ideas?

fields.Title: You: "Step closer."
fields.Dialogue Text: Step closer.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like tomorrow never came." T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Looks like tomorrow never came." The lieutenant raises the collar of his bomber jacket.

fields.Title: Shivers: "*WHAT ARE YOU DOING HERE?* A terrib..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *WHAT ARE YOU DOING HERE?* A terrible cold comes over you as you think the words. They echo in your skull, alien suddenly.

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "Indeed. Somehow you knew it was her..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Indeed. Somehow you knew it was here. An urban ruin gutted by looters that once used to consume money and dispense warmth and light.

fields.Title: You: "Yes. I understand."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. I understand.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "She isn't in the fishing village. S..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She isn't in the fishing village. She's not with her bullet under the floorboards in the shack. So where could she be?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean we should do that *right..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You mean we should do that *right now*, don't you?" the lieutenant asks, his usually even tone wavering slightly. "Can that be done *after* the murder investigation?"

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "... Well, in fairness, you haven't..."
fields.Dialogue Text: ... Well, in fairness, you haven't seen much more of the coast. But you do know one last thing: ULAN. Ruby dabbles in advanced radio theories. ULAN, the Speedfreaks mystery -- it might just be related.
fields.Alternate1: And you do know one thing about radios: ULAN. Ruby dabbles in advanced radio theories. ULAN, the Speedfreaks mystery -- it might just be related.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant glances down the coa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant glances down the coast, toward the fishing village. "There's also still the question of how the twins tuned into Speedfreaks FM..."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Feld Electrical -- you only know th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Feld Electrical -- you only know them as a small company that makes ink cartridges. Looks like they used to be... big.

fields.Title: You: "Listen to the wind."
fields.Dialogue Text: Listen to the wind.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay -- why?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay -- why?"

fields.Title: Shivers: "Suddenly there's a sigh, carried on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Suddenly there's a sigh, carried on the molecules around you, moving, flowing from high pressure to low pressure. Like that of a woman emptying her lungs. She wraps the collapsing stone box in front of you in her breath, flowing through it...

fields.Title: You: "Come on, hurry up, we're on a sched..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Come on, hurry up, we're on a schedule here!

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "You don't know how it happened. But..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You don't know how it happened. But the stores of your knowledge are vast and there *is* something crucial in them.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Nor is Ruby in the Church. Some cri..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Nor is Ruby in the Church. Some criminals still seek sanctuary from sacred buildings, even though sanctuary laws were abolished decades ago. But Ruby wasn't such a one.
fields.Alternate1: Nor is Ruby in the church. The crab-man, Tiago, is -- but not Ruby. Some criminals seek sanctuary from sacred buildings, though the sanctuary laws were abolished decades ago. But Ruby wasn't such a one.
fields.Alternate2: You've even entered the Church, met Tiago, and Soona. Some criminals seek sanctuary from sacred buildings, though the sanctuary laws were abolished decades ago. But Ruby wasn't such a one.
fields.Alternate3: You've even entered the Church, helped the ravers set up a night club, and overheard... well, we don't need to think about that. Point is: Some criminals seek sanctuary from sacred buildings, though the sanctuary laws were abolished decades ago. But Ruby wasn't such a one.

fields.Title: You: ""We should look into that before we..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We should look into that before we move on."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "A prayer of sorts? To Revachol."
fields.Dialogue Text: A prayer of sorts? To Revachol.

fields.Title: Shivers: "Anyway -- you do it sector by secto..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Anyway -- you do it sector by sector. Go over the whole peninsula, ask the locals, enter the places which you *can* enter first.

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "No one. You're just talking to your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No one. You're just talking to yourself again -- the letters slowly peeling off the mural seem to form a malevolent smile.

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""'Ask Revachol' is the name of a wa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "'Ask Revachol' is the name of a war time radio show the communists used to address civil issues," he remarks. "Maybe that helps?"

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Of course. Didn't mean to imply ot..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course. Didn't mean to imply otherwise."

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "There has to be a way to use brute..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There has to be a way to use brute force. Climbing sounds unsafe. Brute force is safe. Look around and find something to break if the ladder fails.

fields.Title: You: ""Yeah, I don't know...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yeah, I don't know..."

fields.Title: You: ""Ever since I woke up -- maybe even..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ever since I woke up -- maybe even before -- I've been getting these strange *cold spells*."

fields.Title: Shivers: "SHE'S DOWN THERE."
fields.Dialogue Text: SHE'S DOWN THERE.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right. How do we get in, though? T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Right. How do we get in, though? The doors were on the collapsed side of this building... they're gone, basically."

fields.Title: Trant Heidelstam: ""I'm not sure, Mikael." He looks at..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not sure, Mikael." He looks at you, as if making an appraisal.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "The alcoholics never mentioned seei..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The alcoholics never mentioned seeing Ruby either. Idiot Doom Spiral gave an exhaustive account of recent events, but never mentioned seeing Ruby.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A shuffle of nylon as the lieutenan..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A shuffle of nylon as the lieutenant shrugs. "It's your call, detective. If you drop the radio lead now, just be prepared to live without having done it."

fields.Title: Feld Mural: "Probably a good idea. Blowing on yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Probably a good idea. Blowing on your fingers doesn't make them much warmer though...

fields.Title: You: "Listen to the wind again."
fields.Dialogue Text: Listen to the wind again.

fields.Title: You: ""And if that fails? If we don't fin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And if that fails? If we don't find her?" (Conclude.)

fields.Title: You: "No. There is something else. In the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. There is something else. In the wind.

fields.Title: You: "[Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: ""What is this building?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What is this building?"

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Somewhere in Martinaise, Lieutenant..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Somewhere in Martinaise, Lieutenant Kitsuragi is consulting his notebook... A sudden draught turns a page between his hands. You're going to need him if you want to listen to the wind.

fields.Title: You: ""Communism is a murder investigatio..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Communism is a murder investigation, Kim. It's about understanding whose bootheel killed the human spirit."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Apologies! You just need time to re..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Apologies! You just need time to remember. There has to be something there. Go do other things around the coast. That might help.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "You've searched the whole coast for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You've searched the whole coast for Morell's traps. Just as you didn't find the Insulindian phasmid, you did not find her.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see. Political theory as detecti..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I see. Political theory as detective work. Right." The lieutenant looks down the coast, toward the shacks. "After you, officer."
